results.title: The Skilled worker
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film examines the inroads of automation on whole areas of satisfaction and reward in work, as exemplified in the story of a craftsman who finds his carefully acquired manual skills displaced by a machine. (Award: Stockholm)

results.title: The Skeleton. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Studies the relationship of speed of movement of the exoskeleton/endoskeleton of animals. Focuses on the human skeleton, showing the various parts and indicating the muscle contractions that lead to skeleton movement. Also indicates the physical and chemical structure of bone and provides an illustration of the strength of hollow bone compared with solid bone. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Studies the relationship of speed of movement of the exoskeleton/endoskeleton of animals. results.title: The Sixth sense [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Spyglass Entertainment, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Barry Mendel and M Night Shyamalan
results.brief_description: This low key supernatural thriller harks back to the days of Val Lewton and Jacques Tourneur’s creepy horror films (“Cat people”, “The Leopard man”, “I walked with a zombie”) where the power of suggestion reigned and a mere shadow would have you jumping in your seat. So to does “The Sixth sense” manage to create that feeling of unknowable dread and terror. The film’s opening sets the mood of unease when renowned child psychologist Dr. Malcolm Crowe (Bruce Willis) is accosted in his home by a disturbed ex-client. Flash forward one year and Dr. Crow is trying to mend the past by helping a new patient, who shares similar traits to his assailant. The patient is Cole Sear (Joel Haley Osment), a troubled young boy who lives his life in constant fear. Why he is scared all the time is one of the many creepy surprises this film holds. What could have easily been a substandard supernatural thriller is elevated by writer, director M. Night Shyamalan and his fine cast (which includes Toni Collette who shines in a all too brief supporting role), all of them showing a quiet restraint which pays off brilliantly in the film’s more frightening moments. Cast also includes Olivia Williams.

results.brief_description: This low key supernatural thriller harks back to the days of Val Lewton and Jacques Tourneur’s creepy horror films (“Cat people”, “The Leopard man”, “I walked with a zombie”) where the power of suggestion reigned and a mere shadow would have you jumping in your seat. So too does “The Sixth sense” manage to create that feeling of unknowable dread and terror. The film’s opening sets the mood of unease when renowned child psychologist Dr. Malcolm Crowe (Bruce Willis) is accosted in his home by a disturbed ex-client. Flash forward one year and Dr. Crowe is trying to mend the past by helping a new patient, who shares similar traits to his assailant. The patient is Cole Sear (Joel Haley Osment), a troubled young boy who lives his life in constant fear. Why he is scared all the time is one of the many creepy surprises this film holds. What could have easily been a substandard supernatural thriller is elevated by writer, director M. results.title: The Sixth part of the world
results.brief_description: Dziga Vertov was the founder of the Soviet documentary. He headed a group of experimental documentarists who took the name Kinoki, or Kino- Eyes. As a militant theorist he proclaimed the supremacy of what would now be called Cinema-Verite. His films and his theoretical writings have had an enormous and lasting influence on world cinema. “The sixth part of the World” is Vertov’s lyrical cinema poem to the vast expanses of the Soviet Union, grand, complicated, exotic and hugely popular.

results.title: The Sixth day of creation
results.creator_credit: Theodora Olembert, Triangle Productions and Francis Maziere
results.brief_description: On the sixth day God created Man and Beast, and since then the law of the jungle has reigned supreme. All species feed on other forms of life: none of them good or evil - just struggling to survive. The strong shall eat the weak - there is no appeal.

results.title: The Six wives of Henry VIII
results.brief_description: Few television series have attracted as much critical and public acclaim as these six triumphant plays, now preserved on video. Written by six different authors each play is a lavish and authentic dramatisation, produced with style and quality. And binding them together with his magnetic and dignified performance as the mighty monarch is Keith Michell - the definitive Henry VIII.

results.title: The Six months examination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
Simple, reliable testing of a child aged six months. The baby’s social development is shown in his positive and inquisitive reaction to the world around him even though his emotional and physical scope is still very limited. Simple vision and learning, motor development, and postural responses are tested.

results.title: The Six billion $$$ sell
results.creator_credit: Consumer Reports Films and Carole Kahn
results.brief_description: A combination of comedy, animation and an original pop theme song are used to expose the questionable techniques of TV commercials. Aims to make viewers aware of how advertising can influence attitudes, values and expectations and helps consumers develop a healthy scepticism about advertising. Illustrations of persuasive advertising techniques include promises, giveaways, star endorsements, word games and branch loyalty. Features Billy Crystal.
